result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany Marie Konieczka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brittany Marie Konieczka is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brittany Marie Konieczka was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 through 14.
Defendant to report to Probation today October 5, 2015.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon application and successful completion of Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan.  ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Brittany Marie Konieczka appeared. Includes 15CF312, 15CM113, 14CF365, and Intake for 15CM602. Case called at 9:39 am. ADA Correll recites agreement. Atty. Chapman confirms. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DF pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CF312 and DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CM602. DF sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DF of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DF Guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF312 and finds DF Guilty of Ct 1 in 15CM602. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Cts 2-14 in 15CF312, dismisses 15CM113 and 14CF365. Court waives PSI and reserves right to Order PSI in future. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

15CF312 - S/W, 4 years probation, with conditions
-5 mos jail STAYED
- Court costs $268
-DNA surcharge $250
-Eligible for expungement upon application and successful completion
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Submit to random/regular testing as required by probation agent
-Participate in restorative justice 
-Maintain employment/education
-Pay all supervision fees
-Participate in all programs required by probation agent

15CM602 - S/W, 1 year probation concurrent - without prejudice to consecutive upon revocation, with conditions
-AODA assessment
-Court costs $243
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Submit to random/regular testing as required by probation agent
-Participate in restorative justice 
-Maintain employment/education
-Pay all supervision fees
-Participate in all programs required by probation agent

-Court finds there is no restitution due for either case.

DF to report to probation today

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Sharon Correll DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman DF: Brittany Marie Konieczka appeared. Case called at 8:36. Court reviews file. Includes 15CF312, 15CM113, 14CF365, 14CF397. S/T Tyesha Davis. Direct by S. Correll. Court questions Ms. Davis. ADA Correll requests to dismiss. Court dismisses 14CF397 without prejudice. Court questions the status of 14CF365. Atty's requests to set for a plea hearing. Bond continues. Address confirmed. Once DE finds a new place to live DE to let the Clerks Office know.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Per Defendant's bond. eif
for Bail Modification filed by Atty Daniel Chapman. eif
Status conference at 08-10-2015 04:30 pm

Includes  14CF397, 15CF312, 14CF365, 15CM113

- Prior to leaving the courthouse, DE to provide mugs and prints. 

- DE to verify address every Friday by 5:00pm at the St. Croix County Jail.
  715-386-4753

- DE to remain at Serenity House. If DE leaves or is kicked out of Serenity House, DE is to return to St. Croix County Jail. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Ronald L, Tyesha D. and John D. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
